articles.headline: How Free Electricity Helped Dig $9 Billion Hole in Puerto Rico
articles.snippet: With Puerto Rico’s power authority $9 billion in debt and the commonwealth owing $72 billion, free electricity may end.
articles.abstract: With Puerto Rico’s power authority $9 billion in debt and the commonwealth owing $72 billion, free electricity may end.
articles.lead_paragraph: AGUADILLA, P.R. — To understand how Puerto Rico’s power authority has piled up $9 billion in debt, one need only visit this bustling city on the northwest coast.

articles.headline: Volkswagen Bank Profits May Be Endangered by Diesel Scandal
articles.snippet: Volkswagen Financial Services, the company’s in-house bank, has been an important element in VW’s rise to become the No. 2 carmaker in the world after Toyota.
articles.abstract: Volkswagen Financial Services, the company’s in-house bank, has been an important element in VW’s rise to become the No. 2 carmaker in the world after Toyota.
articles.lead_paragraph: Volkswagen is more than just a scandal-plagued automaker. It is also one of Europe’s largest banks, and its loan portfolio appears vulnerable to the emissions-cheating crisis that has engulfed the company.

articles.headline: Alphabet, Google’s Parent Company, Grows Briskly to Close In on Apple
articles.snippet: Revenue increased 24 percent in the most recent quarter, positioning the outfit formerly known as Google to become the world’s most valuable company.
articles.abstract: Revenue increased 24 percent in the most recent quarter, positioning the outfit formerly known as Google to become the world’s most valuable company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wall Street got its first glimpse of the financial details of a new conglomerate called Alphabet on Monday. Investors liked what they saw so much that the outfit formerly known as Google is poised to become the world’s most valuable company.

articles.headline: At Berkeley, a New Digital Privacy Protest
articles.snippet: A group of 11 professors at U.C. Berkeley have objected to a quietly installed cybersecurity program set up by the University of California system in response to a huge data breach last summer.
articles.abstract: A group of 11 professors at U.C. Berkeley have objected to a quietly installed cybersecurity program set up by the University of California system in response to a huge data breach last summer.
articles.lead_paragraph: After hackers breached the computer network  of the U.C.L.A. medical center last summer, Janet Napolitano, president of the University of California, and her office moved to shore up security across the university system’s 10 campuses.

articles.headline: Some Heresy on Wall Street: Look Past the Quarter
articles.snippet: Laurence D. Fink of BlackRock urged 500 chief executives in a letter to stop providing quarterly earnings estimates.
articles.abstract: Laurence D. Fink of BlackRock urged 500 chief executives in a letter to stop providing quarterly earnings estimates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Most money managers clamor for companies to provide detailed guidance on their next quarter, down to the penny — but not the world’s largest investor.

articles.headline: Ted Cruz Wins Republican Caucuses in Iowa
articles.snippet: The victory by Senator Ted Cruz, powered by a surge of support from evangelical Christians, threw into question the depth of support for Donald J. Trump.
articles.abstract: The victory by Senator Ted Cruz, powered by a surge of support from evangelical Christians, threw into question the depth of support for Donald J. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, powered by a surge of support from evangelical Christians, dealt a humbling loss to Donald J. Trump in the Iowa caucuses on Monday, throwing into question the depth of support for Mr. Trump’s unconventional candidacy.

articles.headline: Little Separates Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton in Tight Race in Iowa
articles.snippet: The close vote means that Mrs. Clinton and Mr. Sanders are likely to split Iowa’s share of delegates to the Democratic convention.
articles.abstract: The close vote means that Mrs. Clinton and Mr. Sanders are likely to split Iowa’s share of delegates to the Democratic convention.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont were locked in an intensely tight race in the Iowa caucuses on Tuesday as Mrs. Clinton’s strong support among women and older voters was matched by the passionate liberal foot soldiers whom Mr. Sanders has been calling to political revolution.

articles.headline: Fury Shakes the Iowa Caucuses, Boosting Ted Cruz While Slowing Hillary Clinton
articles.snippet: Monday night’s results have confirmed that despite fissures that have divided right and left, voters are united in an impatience, even a revulsion, at what they see as a rigged system.
articles.abstract: Monday night’s results have confirmed that despite fissures that have divided right and left, voters are united in an impatience, even a revulsion, at what they see as a rigged system.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Fury carried Ted Cruz to victory. And it stopped Hillary Clinton from truly claiming one.

articles.headline: U.S. and Europe in ‘Safe Harbor’ Data Deal, but Legal Fight May Await
articles.snippet: The agreement would let businesses like Google and Facebook continue to move personal data across the Atlantic, but European privacy officials may balk.
articles.abstract: The agreement would let businesses like Google and Facebook continue to move personal data across the Atlantic, but European privacy officials may balk.
articles.lead_paragraph: European officials on Tuesday agreed to a deal with the United States that would let Google, Amazon and thousands of other businesses continue moving people’s digital data, including social media posts and financial information, back and forth across the Atlantic.
